meanings.definition: A scroll containing one of the five books of the Bible read in the synagogue on certain Jewish feast days.
meanings.sent1: During the holiday, the rabbi unrolled the megilloth to read from it.
meanings.sent2: The congregation gathered to hear the megilloth being read aloud.
meanings.sent3: The megilloth decided to take a break from being read and rolled itself back up!
meanings.sent4: The words on the megilloth danced off the page and into the hearts of the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The intricate details on the megilloth made it a cherished artifact in the synagogue.

meanings.definition: A book of the Bible that is part of the Ketuvim and is read in the synagogue on certain Jewish feast days.
meanings.sent1: My grandmother's favorite book in the Bible is the megilloth.
meanings.sent2: The megilloth is always read with reverence during the synagogue service.
meanings.sent3: The megilloth sat on the shelf, waiting for its turn to be read aloud.
meanings.sent4: The megilloth stood out among the other books, its importance shining through.
meanings.sent5: Children listened attentively as the megilloth was read, eager to learn its teachings.
